001package com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.WalletEvents;
002
003import com.pingidentity.did.sdk.client.service.model.Challenge;
004import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.WalletMessage.credential.CredentialAction;
005import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.WalletMessage.credential.CredentialEventType;
006import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.WalletMessage.credential.CredentialMessage;
007import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.WalletMessage.pairing.PairingPayload;
008
009// Wallet Credential Event received in callbacks, can be used to ask the app to "update" an existing credential (save new credential and delete the reference credential, giving users the impression of an update)
010public class WalletCredentialEvent implements WalletEvent{
011    public static WalletEventType TYPE = WalletEventType.CREDENTIAL_UPDATE;
012
013    public String applicationInstanceId;
014    public String sender;
015    public Challenge challenge;
016
017    private CredentialMessage credentialMessage;
018
019    public WalletCredentialEvent(String applicationInstanceId, String sender, Challenge challenge, CredentialMessage credentialMessage){
020        this.applicationInstanceId = applicationInstanceId;
021        this.sender = sender;
022        this.challenge = challenge;
023        this.credentialMessage = credentialMessage;
024    }
025    @Override
026    public WalletEventType getType() {
027        return TYPE;
028    }
029
030    @Override
031    public String getSender() {
032        return sender;
033    }
034
035    @Override
036    public Challenge getChallenge() {
037        return challenge;
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * Returns Wallet Credential Event type
042     * @return CredentialEventType
043     */
044    public CredentialEventType getCredentialEvent(){
045        return credentialMessage.getCredentialEvent();
046    }
047
048    /**
049     * Reference credential id for the event, this id can be used to look up the reference credential and perform any operations on it if needed
050     * @return String credential id
051     */
052    public String getReferenceCredentialId(){
053        return credentialMessage.getReferenceCredentialId();
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Action to be performed on reference credentia
058     * @return CredentialAction
059     */
060    public CredentialAction getAction() {
061        return credentialMessage.getAction();
062    }
063
064    public String getApplicationInstanceId() {
065        return applicationInstanceId;
066    }
067}
